page.title: 02RELIGION ST.ANDREWS CHURCH
page.content: Chardstock Church was rebuilt in 1864 by Revd Charles Woodcock.The Church is dedicated to St Andrew.The oldest part of the Church is the south side where the old porch is.In the church there is the choir vestry and pews for the choir in the chancel.In the choir there are 20 or more people.There are 2 Churchwardens Mr.P.J.Wood and Lt Col.G.Read.The present Vicar is Revd.A.Mason.The parish in the diocese of Exeter belongs to the Axminster Team Ministry.The Church is also connected to the School which is named after St.Andrew.The Church is Cruciform with a nave and a north and south transepts.The tower is a square with 6 bells cast in 1868.The bell on which the clock strikes the hour was cast in the 18th century.The main Sunday service is at 9.30a.m .The congragtion averages 50 people.
